source_sentence: (出陀羅尼集經第十一諸天下卷)
translation: (From the Dhāraṇī Collection Sutra, Eleventh Universal Scroll)

source_sentence: 曩謨尾那翼迦(二合)瀉賀悉底(二合)母佉瀉怛儞野(二合)佗唵娜(去聲下同)翼迦(二合)娜翼迦(二合)尾娜翼迦(二合)尾娜翼迦(二合)怛囉(二合)簸哩(二合)怛囉(二合)翼迦(二合)餉(引)佉賀悉底(二合)餉(引)佉迦只多扇(上)底迦囉(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)心呪唵儗(上)哩虐心中心呪唵虐虐吽娑嚩(二合引)賀若欲作此天法。
translation: "If he wants to do this celestial deed, he must first draw an image.
First, you must paint an image.

source_sentence: 或用白鑞銅木等及花木。
translation: You might use pewter, copper, wood, or other floral wood.
If he casts or carves one, he'll get it.
The image takes the form of a man and wife.
"The two bodies of a husband and wife are made to stand next to each other.
Each is five inches long.
Either seven inches or both is acceptable.
They should both be made into elephant-headed figures.
The making of the image mustn't be at odds with the price.
After the image is made, it will be made on the day of the white moon.
It should be made on the first day of the white moon.
He'll put it in a clean room.
He'll make a round altar of pure cow-dung.
Make it any size you like.
You should take a liter of pure, fine sesame oil.
Fill it with pure copper utensils.

source_sentence: 用上呪文呪油一百八遍。
translation: Use the above-mentioned dhāraṇī to incant the oil one hundred and eight times.
That will warm the oil.
Then, place the image in the oil.
Set it on the altar.
Use a clean copper spoon or ladle to fill it with oil.

source_sentence: 灌其二像頂身一百八遍。
translation: He pours the oil over the tops of the two images one hundred and eight times.
He pours it seven times in a day.

source_sentence: 平曉四遍日午三遍共成七遍。
translation: Four times at dawn and three times at noon, making a total of seven times.

source_sentence: 已後每日更呪舊油以灌其像。
translation: Each day thereafter, he pours the same amount of oil over the images.
He does this for seven days.
Whatever his mind desires, he'll attain his goal.
When the oil is being poured, he repeatedly makes the vow.
Again, he makes a ball of ghee and honey, mixes it with bread, and mixes it with radish root and a cup of wine.
It's made with carrot root and a cup of wine.
It's also made from new flowers and fruits at the time of the joyful festival.
Each day, he takes a new one and makes offerings to it.
All good deeds are accomplished as he wishes.
All calamities will cease.

source_sentence: 其所獻食必須自食始得氣力。
translation: The food that he offers must be eaten by himself before he gains strength.
He invokes the mudrā.
Take your two pinkies and two ring fingers.
Hook them together and turn them inward.
Then, he takes his two middle fingers and crosses them at the tip.
Then, he takes his two index fingers.
Attach each one to his middle finger.
He takes his two big fingers and raises them up.
Nearby, he puts his head finger to the side.
The big fingers come and go.
The mantra is.

source_sentence: 唵簸迦囉(二合)主拏禰(去)嚩哆野(二合)誦七遍。
translation: Om pakkara (sextuplets), lord na'i (depart), and vadāna (sextuplets), recite it seven times.
Praise Mantra

source_sentence: 唵誐娜簸(波上下同)底扇(上聲呼)底娑嚩(二合引)悉底摩賀誐娜簸底娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)送呪唵簸迦囉(二合)主拏禰(去)嚩哆野(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)誦七遍。
translation: Om gaṇapati (the lower case is the same as the upper case), siddhi (the second case), moha (the second case), and he (citation) recites the mantra oṃpakara (the second case) seven times.
Dhāraṇī for Protecting the Body with Water

source_sentence: 唵吉里吉里跋折囉(二合引)吽泮吒(半音)若欲作法時。
translation: Om gṛdhrakūṭa pāñjara (Sanskrit: Avalokitêśvara) un paṇḍa (Sanskrit: Avalokitêśvara) When he wants to perform a ritual, he first dares to recite the above dhāraṇī seven times.
First, he should recite the above dhāraṇī seven times over with water.
He washes his mouth with it.
He then takes the water and uses it seven times.

source_sentence: 用楊柳散灑身上即為護身。
translation: Sprinkle it on your body with willow scatter to protect yourself.

source_sentence: 然後入持誦室中作法之所。
translation: Then, he enters the room where he recites the spell and performs the ritual.
Bathing Dhāraṇī

source_sentence: 唵阿拏婆折唎(二合)婆跛隷拏訶
translation: Om anavataprāpta (verse) bhagavat

source_sentence: 以上呪呪水七遍當用洗浴。
translation: The above dhāraṇī should be used seven times to wash the water.
The Method of Harmonizing Vinatiṣka

source_sentence: 請一切天作帝殊羅施印。
translation: He invites all the gods to make the sign of Tejorā's salutation.
He takes his two pinky fingers and ring finger.
Put them together in the palm of your hand.
He twists the tips of his two middle fingers together.

source_sentence: 以二頭指各加中指背第一節下半分。
translation: Take the two index fingers and add the lower half of the first knuckle on the back of the middle finger.
He then gives them his big finger.
The mantra for going and coming is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鑠都嚕(二)波羅摩馱儞曳(三)莎訶誦七遍。
translation: "Om(1) 鑠āduru(2) Pāramādanī(3) is a spell that's recited seven times.
But the person who recites the mantra is terrified in a dream.
He sees the unwholesome realms of animals and so forth.
He should know that it's the anger of King Vināyaka.

source_sentence: 夢中覺已即慚愧乞莫瞋。
translation: After realizing it in the dream, he then consciously begs not to get angry.
Tomorrow, he'll eat and drink, and then he'll give thanks.

source_sentence: 以水摩地作二肘水圓壇。
translation: He makes a two-elbow water altar out of water and muddi.
It's like the great altar of Pāṇḍu.

source_sentence: 即取[飢-几+蒸]餅五顆蘿蔔根三顆火燒熟。
translation: He then took [hunger - a few + steam] cakes and five radishes and three carrots, and he burned them.

source_sentence: 有花著花并燒白膠薰陸等香安於壇中。
translation: Putting flowers on the altar and burning incense such as white glue and fumigant oil, he places them on the altar.
The person whose spell is being recited sits facing east on the west side of the altar.

source_sentence: 誦大自在天呪一百八遍已。
translation: After reciting the Mahātejas garuḍêndra dhāraṇī one hundred and eight times, he says.
He says with his mouth, "Good riddance, shame!
After saying these words, he said.
He fills a dish with various things on the altar.
He leaves the altar and goes west to throw them away.
He could also go northwest.

source_sentence: 口云薩婆藥叉囉闍阿藹捨訶娑鉢闍伽車。
translation: He said, "Sapa Yakṣa Rāja Āśaiha sabhāja-gaccha.
After saying this, he discarded it and returned.
The Mahātejas garuḍêndra spell says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)毘跢囉薩尼(二)波囉末唎達尼(三)瞋達尼瞋達尼(四)頻達尼頻達尼(五)莎訶誦呪一百八遍。
translation: "Om (1) vairocana (2) boromalidāni (3) angrada ni angrada ni (4) vandana ni vandana ni (5) sahā recites the mantra one hundred and eight times.
He then rejoices, not only in his dreams.

source_sentence: 但覺有魔事即作前法定好。
translation: He simply perceives the presence of Māra and instantly creates the previous charms.
Statue-making Method
Its image is shaped like a protuberance.
It's an elephant-headed figure.
His left tusk is protruding, and his right tusk is broken.
His face is little to the left.
Its trunk is fistulous toward the outside.
It has six arms.
In his left hand, he holds a sword in his upper hand.
In the second hand, he holds a fruit bowl.
In his lower hand, he holds a wheel.
In his upper right hand, he holds a stick.
In the second hand, he handles a rope.
In the lower hand, he holds a tooth.
Making this image doesn't violate its value.
He'll pay for it in full.
If he casts, carves, or paints it, he'll get it.
Right, this is the great sage's great secret essential teaching.
It's rare for humans to have one.
It's really not to be transmitted, so it's advisable to admonish caution.
